intro: Oenothera brachycarpa var. typica, commonly known as the short-fruited evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its foliage consists of alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
